description:
I believe this is because the following call was added to compute/api.py:

@wrap_check_policy
def get_all_instance_metadata(self, context, search_filts):

And check_policy needs a target (an instance) to check against -- all the other functions that use this wrapper have (self, context, instance) as the first three arguments.

Removing the wrapper lets the call succeed, but is it the right thing to do?

--

title: nova ec2-api: euca-describe-tags fails with UnknownError

comments.content:
I believe this is because the following call was added to compute/api.py:

@wrap_check_policy
def get_all_instance_metadata(self, context, search_filts):

And check_policy needs a target (an instance) to check against -- all the other functions that use this wrapper have (self, context, instance) as the first three arguments.

Removing the wrapper lets the call succeed, but is it the right thing to do?

--

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~holzman

comments.content: Maybe sending in the context as an extra argument makes sense since it has the project_id.  I'll submit a patch.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~holzman

comments.content:
On second thought, that doesn't make much sense, it would always evaluate to true.

We should probably fetch all the metadata and add a post-filtering step where we loop through the
instances and check the policy on each.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~holzman

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/36241
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/08559964bd209de823fd5e4738519514172d0b26
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 08559964bd209de823fd5e4738519514172d0b26
Author: Burt Holzman <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jul 9 09:03:12 2013 -0500

    Replace get_instance_metadata call in api.ec2.cloud._format_instances
    
    The _format_instances method in api.ec2.cloud populates an instance
    dictionary from the sqlalchemy instance model objects, and populates the
    metadata by calling compute.api.get_instance_metadata.
    
    This is unnecessary, since the instance objects already have metadata
    attached. The helper class is needed until the migration to nova objects
    is complete.
    
    Partially fixes bug #1192715
    
    Change-Id: Ib5a593bd36c8d6a531b9494b9861cca9a40ed08a
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:

Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/c43bc58aa1e2dfaf3c6787560ec2d09af0a819ae
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit c43bc58aa1e2dfaf3c6787560ec2d09af0a819ae
Author: Burt Holzman <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jul 9 09:49:37 2013 -0500

    Sort output for unit tests in test_describe_tags before compare
    
    There's no guarantees on what order the output from describe_tags
    comes back in, so it needs to be sorted.
    
    Partially fixes bug #1192715
    
    Change-Id: Ibb2619e8077ea8b8bd4796f9ffe89c2376d047f6
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/36244
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b48789f14b41b7f017f84a5d832e9283a0808ef4
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit b48789f14b41b7f017f84a5d832e9283a0808ef4
Author: Burt Holzman <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jul 9 09:58:20 2013 -0500

    Change get_all_instance_metadata to use _get_instances_by_filters
    
    We need an instance list for invoking check_policy against when calling
    get_all_instance_metadata. Since the _get_instances_by_filters
    call also returns associated instance metadata, we can use this instead
    of db.api.get_all_instance_metadata.
    
    Fixes bug #1192715
    
    Change-Id: Idb005b7227447308a8d060be7aa9ff5c70b5ff44
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
